law.catch_line: Information required from persons holding commercial driver's license or applying to be a commercial driver.

text.section:
Any driver who holds a commercial driver's license or who is required to hold a commercial driver's license shall within thirty (30) days in the manner specified by the cabinet:
Notify the cabinet of any conviction of a state law or local ordinance, relating to motor vehicle traffic control, other than a parking violation, committed in another state or jurisdiction; and
Notify his employer in writing of any conviction of a state law or local ordinance, relating to motor vehicle traffic control other than a parking violation, committed in any state or jurisdiction.

Any driver whose commercial driver's license is suspended, revoked, or canceled by any state, or who loses the privilege to drive a motor vehicle in any state for any period, including being disqualified from driving a commercial motor vehicle, or a driver who is subject to an out of service order, shall notify his employer of that fact before the end of the business day following the day the driver received notice of that fact.
An employer may require an applicant to provide information additional to that required by subsection (3) of this section.

law.history: Created 1990 Ky. Acts ch. 455, sec. 7, effective July 1, 1991.
